definition: well-known for sth/to become well known/to make one's mark

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
lit. people fear getting famous like pigs fear fattening up (for the slaughter)/fig. fame has its price
pinyin: ren2 pa4 chu1 ming2 zhu1 pa4 zhuang4

definition: lit. people fear getting famous like pigs fear fattening up (for the slaughter)/fig. fame has its price
pinyin: ren2 pa4 chu1 ming2 zhu1 pa4 fei2

definition: to make it/to be somebody
to come from a distinguished family
to make a name for oneself

sentences.english: This city is noted for its manufacture of earthenware .
sentences.chinese: 這城市以陶器的製造而出名。

sentences.english: Jingde Town is known as a china-producing place.
sentences.chinese: 景德鎮是一個出名的瓷器產地。

sentences.english: Chico also was known for performing what was called the comedy of the absurd.
sentences.chinese: Chico也因爲出演被叫做荒誕劇的劇目而出名。

sentences.english: They are famous for the lifelike reality of their paintings.
sentences.chinese: 他們因對事物的描繪幾乎接近真實而出名。

sentences.english: Can you tell us what Portobello Road is famous for?
sentences.chinese: 你能告訴我們波託貝洛大道是因什麼而出名的嗎？

sentences.english: Guangning is the home of bamboo and famous for its picturesque scenery .
sentences.chinese: 廣寧是著名的竹子之鄉，以優美的自然景色而出名。

sentences.english: Then they found a young fish who was known for playing hooky from school.
sentences.chinese: 於是他們找了條以逃學出名的小魚仔。

sentences.english: The one activity Palau is most famous for among adventurous travelers is diving.
sentences.chinese: 對喜愛冒險的遊客來說，帛琉最出名的活動就是潛水。

sentences.english: This is a light comedy and famous for the antiphonal singing of the spouses.
sentences.chinese: 這是一出小喜劇，以夫妻對唱而出名。

sentences.english: They are probably the most famous party planners in the world.
sentences.chinese: 現在他們可能是全球最出名的派對策劃公司了。

sentences.english: It is known as the Dragon Boat Festival because it involves dragon boat races;
sentences.chinese: 它因“龍舟節”出名，因爲人們要在那天划龍舟。

sentences.english: The best-known British dish eaten at home has been roast beef, traditionally eaten on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 英國最出名的家庭菜是烤牛肉，通常在週日喫。

sentences.english: When I first entered the entertainment industry, there was another Song Jia who was already very famous.
sentences.chinese: 在我剛進演藝圈的時候，另一個宋佳已經很出名了。

sentences.english: In later years, Salinger become famous for not wanting to be famous, refusing interviews.
sentences.chinese: 晚年的塞林格卻因爲拒絕採訪不願出名而爲世人所知。

sentences.english: Duan Linxi is famous for her beautiful songs, in the super girl this year.
sentences.chinese: 在幾年的快樂女生中，段林希以她美妙的歌聲而出名。

sentences.english: Dan, another anonymized pal of mine, made his name in real estate.
sentences.chinese: 我的另一位天才朋友，因房地產事業而出名。

definition: famous/well-known
well-known/famous/renowned/eminent
reputation/fame
grand reputation/renowned/famous
famous/noted/well-known/celebrated
to be famous far and wide (idiom)
to rise to fame
to make one's name/to become famous
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
popular/well-received
to be well acquainted with
to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
world-famous
famous/celebrated
famous reputation
